There is no setting for widescreen monitors.  The game crops the top and bottom off handicapping you unless you successfully google how to set up windowed mode so you can play normal.  Caused me a TON of headache until I figured out how to fix it.

The game itself is a slow burn at first but quickly grabs you once you get a couple good rounds.

Lots of fun to be had and lots of rewards the more you play (especially if you unlock the pass).

Before playing this game I had no girlfriend, some will to live, free time, no friends and money in my bank account.

I still don't have a girlfriend or any friends but now I have no money in my bank account, no free time (bc all my time is spent playing this game) and i have 0 will to live.

but still a good game if you take away the 10 bugs that get added after they try to fix 1 bug.

11/10 I play it everyday

I am a 69-year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing DBD. 
I am a single father to my son, who is now 17. My son recently started playing DBD. 

In less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me because it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son because he was always out with his friends or watching The YouTube. 

So I decided to make a Steam account to play with my son. I started playing, but this was my first time playing a video game since the 90's, so I was quite lost. I asked my son for help, and together we spent hours playing DBD. He taught me how to loop and I even teabagged the killer at one point.

Steam has ever since brought me and my son closer again, and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. DBD reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.
The games fun, the community is hilarious... If you love 1v4 style games, this is probably among the best out there

I have a love-hate relationship with this game, it's concept is great and the gameplay as a whole is really fun, solo queue and with friends.

However, it has many bugs, glitches and alot of balancing issues, a large amount more problems than what your average game is, but at the end of the day. The game will be over in a few minutes anyway!

The majority of this game's community are toxic crybabies who when they don't get what they want, they keep crying to "mama behaviour that it's unfair the other team has the advantage"

It's an asymmetrical game, one of the hardest game genres to balance. It's devs don't really listen to the community, sure. But they are doing their best. (I think.)

tl;dr Game is fun, you should get. But be warned, toxic community and quite a few issues.

Edit: Game is now a dumpster fire and BHVR only cares about making money, they do not care at all about the state of the game itself OR the community's opinion.
